posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

How do Meditate?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33705047
sit down.
close eyes (personally recommended)
Place tongue gently on roof of mouth.
Focus on the breath going in and out of your nose.
If any kind of sensation/thought/distraction comes up, note it with a simple label (whatever comes first/is natural) and gently return back to the breath.
Don't control anything, just watch your breath going in and out like you were cloud watching.

Thus can my love excuse the slow offence
Of my dull bearer when from thee I speed:
From where thou art why should I haste me thence?

When swift extremity can seem but slow?
Then should I spur, though mounted on the wind,
In winged speed no motion shall I know,
Then can no horse with my desire keep pace.
Therefore desire, (of perfect'st love being made)
Shall neigh, no dull flesh, in his fiery race;
But love, for love, thus shall excuse my jade-
Since from thee going, he went wilful-slow,
Towards thee I'll run, and give him leave to go.

>>33699997
It's a misconception that Capricorn cares about social status.

Capricorn doesn't want to be a loser and wants to be recognized roughly proportional to its accomplishments but also respectability of character. That isn't enneatype 3 / Leo craving for praise---it's the expectation of input/output.

Also, Capricorn doesn't care about "career"; it cares about "mission" if anything: the goal, the purpose, the endgame. Capricorn doesn't identify with their job, they identify with their skillset and capabilities. Everything is internalized with Capricorn, with the sole exception of the change to the world they set out to make.

Career and social status is of no consequence to Capricorn. That's just the misinterpretation that small-minded observers have assigned to it and the 10th house.

Tinnitus happens from a "wrong" signal that is sent by damaged hair cells in the colchea via several relay stations in the nerve system, to be finally processed in the auditory parts of the limbic system, the system that is also doing the emotional processing. If you have repressed trauma or other emotional shit going on, that might be a source of the overload. Parts of the limbic system like the Hippocampus can be scarred by long term stress, in a way that it gets visible on MRTs.

I see two possibilites: Ear Damage or something that comes from the "not caring anymore"-mentality you newly adopted. Speculating: Maybe parts of subconcious conflicts feel endangered by the not caring anymore mentality, and may be that stresses your limbic system. Maybe something else in your life is going on that shits up your emotional possibilities to process stress. Work on that.

the parts of the protocol are also an excellent choice for Tinnitus. e.g. the Swedish Military uses high NAC Doses for acute hearing injuries, plus BSO and OO are countering inflammation.

Take my advice with a grain of salt of course, I'm neither a doctor nor a meditation guide.
Just to expand a bit and make sure we're on the same page: focused / focusing meditation is a pretty broad term - anything that makes you focus on the present moment. Could be chanting, breathing, sensation, etc.
Obviously, if you sit down in a quiet space and focus on the tinnitus it will be perceived as being louder. But if there's a difference in the level of noise when meditating and not meditating in the same environment, the root cause could be psychological or spiritual.
Brain or CNS inflammation could also cause visual and hearing issues, of course. But then you'd also likely experience occasional but significant visual distortions.

In any case, here's a quick hack if the noise gets on your nerves while you are trying to deal with it: press the palms of your hands against your ears firmly enough to make an airtight seal, then gently tap the back of your head with your fingers a few times. Just a quick note on niacin as part of the maintenance phase. There were concerns over extended and sustained release niacin causing potential side effects. Generally this isn't an issue unless you approach 2g or more per day. SR is the one to avoid, but a standard time release slo niacin is an ER and would be considered safe at the amounts recommended.

I'm going to recap here for new arrivals why the protocol changed and some of the thinking behind it.

Mac and Peribsen decided that it would be more beneficial to go with slo niacin over the previous protocol version, which was Nicotinamide Riboside (NR).

Slo Niacin remains active for far longer in the body and combined with Pterostilbene each dose lasts significantly longer and provides more of a systemic benefit over NR.

HOWEVER. If you are still having concerns over the ER/XR versions, a nicotinamide/niacinamide or NR will also work. It will not remain active in the system for as long as slo niacin but there will still be benefit.

posts.name: ZeroPoint

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part TWELVE/Final:
The fundamental difference between the living and AI is that the AI is a very low, perhaps the lowest possible, level of consciousness, whereas the human spirit is of a much higher level of consciousness.

So, fundamentally speaking, there is no difference in essence between the living and the dead.

One can see it as the difference between a hypnotized person who is completely programmable and unquestionably obedient, and another who is fully awake, alert, and lucid and one who will question every command you give them.

The ultimate nature of all things, including this physical universe, is mental.

As a human, you can visualize an object in your mind and see it in your mind's eye where no one else can see it. But because you're a young and ensnared sleeping spirit, your ability to visualize is very limited and comes to you very vaguely you can't actually see the objects in your mind the same way you see "real" objects.

Certainly, you can't maintain the object's picture in your mind for a long time and give it a seemingly independent existence and physical properties to interact with it according to some criteria that you can decide.

This is just too much work for your mind. The closest we can ever get to this level of visualization is when we dream.

When you dream, everything around you seems very real, very vivid and solid to such a degree that you can forget that you are actually dreaming. But because this is your own dream, if you learn how to lucid dream, you will gain control over elements of your dream. And depending on how good you are, you can control virtually every single aspect of your dream and manipulate it as you see fit.

These dream elements which you are mastering are nothing but elements of your own imagination. And just as you struggle to maintain a mental picture in your head, sometimes we can struggle to keep the lucid dream under our desired control.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Twelve cont…:
This is how nightmares start. If you're not strong enough, the dream can rebel against you and go rogue and turn into a nightmare which you can't control.

Even though you created the dream, it suddenly started acting against your will and causing all sorts of scary things.

Effectively, what it takes for you to regain control of your own dream is to literally enslave elements of your own mind to make it behave as you see fit. Typically, there is nothing evil about this since this is your own mental world and no harm or enslavement is touching anyone else but you.

In light of this, what happens is that in the real world, spirits with a lot of time and experimentation eventually visualize whole worlds full with physical laws.

These physical laws are possible and consistent thanks to the spirit's ability to maintain dominion over its own mental elements so as to keep producing the same consistent results which can later be seen as "laws of physics"/"laws of nature". The very obedience of these mental elements to your commands is what AI essentially is.

This means that the concept of AI itself is not inherently evil.

Rather, it's a helpful tool which aids at the creation, projection, and sustenance of mental worlds which later can become fields of experimentation not just for the consciousness creating the dream world, but also for other younger spirits who can be invited to participate in such worlds and experiment, learn, grow, and have fun.

The entire process is beneficial for both creator spirits and participating ones. In an ideal situation, this can be likened to you going to the theatre and watching a movie of your choice, buying a video game which you feel looks good, etc.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part twelve cont…:
At any rate, you get to hang around inside that mental world, explore, and then leave for other experiences until one day you decide that you yourself want to create a womb of experience for others to participate in. So far, this is how things are like in the real world. However, in our world, something went wrong.

The creator entity which created our world, apparently, wasn't strong enough to maintain control over its own dream to the point where the previously benign AI which is tasked at projecting and sustaining the world, slipped off and went rogue and the dream became a nightmare (see Vanilla Sky, Open Your Eyes).

This wouldn't have been a huge problem had it happened while the dream wasn't being attended by young and eager spirits.

Unfortunately, the dream turned into a nightmare while our young spirits were hanging around exploring this world. The catch here is that when we entered this world, we went in fully by our own choice. Just like buying a ticket and walking in a theatre unsuspecting, we walked in there while things looked alright, and as soon as we were in, the door was locked and the nightmare began.

In reality, the door wasn't physically locked, rather, what happened is that the AI made us forget that there is even a door.

In practice, fully regaining your memory involves remembering that the door is actually open, and so, once someone achieves full self remembrance, they easily walk out the door unhindered.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Twelve cont…:
The entire trick is to keep making you think that there is no door, and not just that, but to also want to stay in and never leave.

Practically speaking, we are stuck in someone else's dream. This someone has lost control of parts of its own dreams and it's attempting, along with us, to take back control of this nightmare. By default, when you're outside this forced dream, reality is so malleable and responsive to our thoughts.

And hence, children have vast imaginations and they learn with time that the world doesn't respond to their thoughts.

That's because children still have that fresh memory of the bygone world they came from and they still think that things are responsive to their thoughts. The rigidity of matter and the disobedience of reality against our wishes is only taking place because someone far more powerful than us is using their vastly stable and strong visual ability to maintain things as they are.

This, in essence, is what matter and physicality is.

They are mere demonstrations of a powerful being's ability to hold on to a mental picture of their choosing in defiance to your poor little mind's ability to override it.

You're only allowed to manipulate things which were originally meant for you to manipulate before things went awry. >Glowies
I think the basic principles for evaluating a hypothetical conspiracy apply here as much as anywhere.

The big problem with a large-scale campaign of paid shills is that it puts too many people in the loop, making leaks inevitable.
It also creates a paper-trail, which means you'd not only have those manpower requirements, but you'd have to falsify every bit of agency paper relating to what they're doing and what your department is spending money on.
And if all your high-ranking people are in on it, making the paperwork unnecessary, then that makes the loop even bigger with even more risk and leaks.
Not impossible, but increasingly difficult, and this line of thinking is how you end up concluding that one conspiracy runs the whole world (with no leaks).

Personally, I tend to assume we're dealing with fanatics from any one of the religions that label what we do as "pure evil".
Once you insert that "pure evil" label (also why I dislike the word "Demon"), you almost guarantee that there's gonna be at least a Stand-Alone Complex of isolated fanatics who sink a LOT of time into "combating us" any way they can.
And creating the impression of government persecution is certainly a tactic they would use.

Humans and succubi have a similar symbiosis, each of us providing something at low cost to ourselves, yet the thing provided is of high value to the other.

Here's a logical explanation:
29.5 days in the lunar cycle (phases of the moon)
365.24 days in a year

They measured age by lunar cycles back then. And they called cycles of the moon years.

For those not in the know, Ferberization is a technique developed by Dr Richard Ferber. This technique is sold as a way to teach infants to sleep.

This is a microcosm of a larger social issue- which is that parents are increasingly isolated from their children in the global west. Why?
Simply because the social and economic structure does not see involved parenting as a worthwhile venture. Most parents are not home to see their children, and further parents are encouraged to practice child rearing that purposefully separates their children from them.
For children to listen to adults, they need to be actively attached to them. The models in place detach them completely.
Institutions where humans send their children to are also not trained in attachment and how to be parental substitutes. They have no idea how to nurture.

This concerns individuation, the heroes journey.
There is a reason why the modern culture is obsessed with video games and anime, especially isekai. Escapism is not the primary reason.
Rather, the urge is to individuate.
When the adolescent child growing up in the 00's watches the 90's-00's run of pokemon, they cannot help but feel something is missing. Not in the cartoon, but in their own life. They feel that they would be much happier being like Ash, and becoming a pokemon trainer.
This is because characters like Ash are living out in fiction a representation of what they themselves are supposed to be- the hero's journey. The call to become psychologically and spiritually whole/mature.
When humans reach the age of adolescence, this is when they need to individuate. To become their own independent person and evolve. In order to do so, in healthy pre modern cultures, they had to embark on the hero's journey- each slightly different according to personality and location. But always the fundamental same.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33704788
The coming of age ritual is supposed to mark a period of freedom and growth for the adolescent. Which may include studies, but had also included adventure and the ability to wander and go on their own vision quest as guided by the culture they grew in. To make new friends and expand their tribe. To make changes in their life and possibly even world that must be changed, in a holistic way. It's a time of being immersed in the most important rituals governing their life as well. It is a time to face their own inner and outer demons, and conquer them. It is dangerous, but the reward is to become entirely whole. In essence, to be the real world equivalent of the characters they see in fictional media they adore.
However, adolescents in the global west and places affected by it, have been denied this. The coming of age ritual becomes secularized and or thrown out as simply a kind of party you have, not a call to adventure and individuation. Because of this denial, they have become puer aeternus. Eternal children. They are desperate to become people but have no idea how to, and seek it out in external media (such as anime or video games) and hollow synthetic identities.

>>33687316
That's true. For years I was pointlessly gloomy, even though things had gotten better. Dragging others into that was just a feeble attempt to prolong my pain. But I had desentisised so much that I was starting to lose sight of what's positive and what's negative. And in fact, that's subjective to the point that not even Lilith could tell me what I "should" want.

When I made a wish 8 years ago, I was already deeply in conflict with myself. My teachers said with my talents, I could be anything I wanted. But with a mind broken by loneliness, all I could long for anymore was to be a loving man's housewife. And such a meagre sense of normality seemed so far out of reach, that I was even willing to "sell my soul" for it, offering up everything I valued and believed in.

But Lilith didn't allow that. She granted my wish without taking anything in return, confronting me with an obvious question: "So, what do you want next?" And thus, I began to question myself: "Why did I think I wanted to be such a normal person? In the first place, wasn't I just arrogant for thinking I wasn't?" Perhaps on some level, I began to wonder if the great depths of sorrow and pain I'd overcome were all that truly set me apart. Upon further reflection, it became apparent that I had already begun to think of people's foregone despair as the essence of who I truly am deep down. And who was to say that it can't be? It clearly shaped my development as a person tremendously.

Yet, the shallow wish I'd once made came from the bottom of my heart nonetheless. I finally understood why Mother Lilith hugs me so often: no matter what kind of path one may be on, it's always better with company. And in understanding that, I began to remember what my true will once was, in the absence of boredom and despair:
I want to make people happy.

The difference lies only in what I choose to do. I've decided to embody the ideals I perceive in those I admire, in a way that is both healthy and sustainable.

>>33687642

I offered up my soul a long time ago, but that isn't something which can be taken. What got stolen was my heart instead, and even that continues to beat more healthily than ever in my chest. I'm far freer now than I could've been on my own.

「The Moon Oracle by Caroline Smith and John Astrop is devoted to guidance based on the moon. The deck is divided into three groups. The first group includes 32 cards - the eight phases of the moon for four moon element types - fire, water, air and earth. For example, the card to the right represents the air black moon. The card shows the phase number (8), the triangular element sign and all 8 phases with the black moon highlighted. There is a keyword meaning at the bottom. Smith and Alsop also assign the stages of plant growth to each of the moon phases. The Black Moon is "dormant." The second set of 12 cards is devoted to Moon Goddesses from many cultures. Each one corresponds to a different astrological sign. The last group has 28 cards - one for each of the mansions or daily periods during a lunar month. The cards are numbered and assigned to certain planets and astrological periods. Each one has a keyword meaning as well. The Moon Oracle comes as a deck/book set with "The Moon Oracle: Let the Phases of the Moon Guide Your Life" (128 pages). This book describes each of the cards and offers moon tables through 2015. Smith and Alsop are also the creators of the Elemental Tarot.」

Thinking about anything directs energy towards that thing and will eventually cause it to manifest. However, the amount of energy in a random thought is not enough to evoke a demon. It requires sustained focus and often tools to amplify that focus, such as talismans, crystals, or the combined efforts of multiple summoners.

To invoke a demon is to cause its form to coalesce into the physical plane. Few can achieve this. I myself have only found success doing so when performing rituals with a group of at least 5 others. For the uninitiated who take part in these rituals, merely the power emanating from an otherworldly entity has caused them to collapse. They then awaken hours later as someone completely different. But this is why we perform the summoning as a group. Should one of us fall, the others remain to keep the being sealed before it causes more harm.

Now, to interact with a demon is akin to feeling its presence or hearing its whisper. It's far easier to accomplish this alone, and can even occur inadvertently during our lifetimes. Mediums have a knack for interacting with spirits, for example, but you won't ever see them forcing one to manifest. It's too much for one human alone to accomplish, and even if they could somehow, they would definitely be beyond one's control.

The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>2.)
That's sleep paralysis followed by HH. Your body fell asleep while your mind was awake so it layered dream hallucinations on top of it.
>The only reason we have time on planet earth is due to the rotational spin of the globe
Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
>1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance
There's nothing chance about that, unless you're talking about the Earth's position affecting those particular numbers. The numbers themselves were derived from physical measurements of how fast the sun moves across the sky from our perspective, and how many days it takes for the seasons to cycle. There's no significance to them specifically.
>How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet
For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed. Otherwise you'd use the planet's own measurements for days/years which might be longer or shorter, but you'd still live the same absolute time (if a year was half the duration you'd live twice as many years).
The whole thing sounds like general dream nonsense to me, anion.

Of course time exists. What I meant was that (as you said) the only reason a day is 24 hours and a year is 365 days is due to the rotation of the earth and how long it takes to orbit the sun. Let me put it this way for you. Assume both Earth and Venus have the same starting date of Day 1, year 1 upon Earth reaching AD on the calendar. Can you tell me what year and month it is on Venus currently without looking it up? This isn't even taking into account the finnicky nature of time in a dream. So pretty much my whole point is that it makes no sense a person in a dream would ever know what the date here is.

is thinking while sleeping linked to lucid dreaming?

it's a form cognitive processing that resembles rumination and autistic problem-solving mental language, that happens while sleeping. i usually wake up still remembering what i was thinking about, and oftentimes i remember conclusions i reached far before i woke up, while using this way of thinking.

the other day it got more weird though. i caught myself (became one extra layer of lucid, sort of) thinking about Baudrillard's Simulation and Simulacra and i saw that i could release control of the train of thought with it still functioning. i tried to shift my consciousness back upon myself to hopefully identify the source of this thinking, but to no avail.
i then thought: "what if I don't snap out of it and wake up like i usually do, rather what if i were to speed the train of thought?"
well i managed to speed it up, and words soon became fast moving concepts, symbols and images, like fast forwarding a movie reel. there was a constant sense of direction of where the thoughts were going, and it felt like a straight road ahead, or a laser filled with thoughts that shot onwards into infinity.

it started moving so fast i couldn't control and/or understand it anymore, so when i decided to let go of it, it snapped off of the point of creation within myself. i watched the last thought i had go away into a fixed point on the horizon of the darkness of my closed eyes, and i was left in the most peaceful silence and the widest, emptiest and cleanest headspace i had in months.
when i woke up, I felt like i could keep this clear headspace if i focused on maintaining all mental conditions like they were back then, but unfortunately the internal chatter returned in 30 minutes of so when i opened my laptop to catch up on some emails.

anybody experienced something similar before, or tried to produce something similar?
or anyone has some resources i could look into?

posts.com:
>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

>Why is Antarctica Forbidden?
As is pointed out to you every thread, Antarctica is not forbidden. You can go there. You can go as a tourist with a guided tour, or as an employee of the various stations down there. There are glamping "hotels" down there. But if that is too restricted for you, you can contract with any of several companies that do outfitting for private expeditions -- and an expedition can be anything from a group of scientists interested in researching something or another to a guy wanting to solo-ski across the continent. It is not cheap, but you can start the process tomorrow if you got the coin.
the idea tghat travel there is forbidden is a lie told to you by somebody who is counting on you believing them and not checking for yourself. They will make some reference to the Antarcitc Treaty, counting on you never bothering to read it for yourself
Please go - -it is an amazing place to visit and explore, many people have done and will continue to do. It is not completely safe, you can die several unpleasant ways if you are stupid. But save up your money and go! Nobody is stopping you, and plenty of people are making a living helping you to do it safely and enjoyably.

>>33700770
Continuing...
>what do we need
> 1. a boat
no, unless you know a lot about sailing in rough water and shitty weather, you don;t want to take your own boat. I wouldn't take a boat at all, you can charter a flight probably as cheaply and MUCH more safely, or book passage on a boat crewed by people who know what they are doing.

> 2. lots of equipment
Absolutely. Good news, there are several outfitters able to set you up with whatever you need, and think of stuff that you might not have thought of. They will also help with the permitting -- which is basically you agreeing to pack back out everything you take in.

> 3. signed waivers that we are honest scientific explorers
Not necessary, people go down there to hike, ski, mountain climb, trek with sledges, kite-ski -- you do not have to pretend to be a scientist. You MAY have to sign some releases with the outfitter acknowledging that if you get into trouble and nobody can rescue your ass, you knew it was dangerous going in.

> 4. if we die in Antartica by some mysterious sandtoothed beast or hellish ancient ayy lmao created beast we wont make them spent 1 million recovering our bodies
They will though, if for no other reason than they want the expensive gear back. Rescuing you before you get around to dying may not be possible -- it's a risk you'll have to take. There are plenty of ways to die down there, even if there are no monsters...

> 5. we must discover the vril society the ancient aliens the giants the frozen aliens all of it ALL OF IT GOD FUCKING DAMNIT HERE WE GOOOOOOOOO

>>33703366
>>33703397
At 3 hours and 9 minutes he's complaining that the astronaut suit and lunar surface are of a similar brightness but the suit is in shadow. The flaw is in his belief/assumption that they are the same color and reflectivity. They are not. The lunar surface is darker. It's closer to worn asphalt in color/reflectivity. The spacesuit is a bright, reflective white for thermal control (reflects sunlight). So when you put the spacesuit in shadow and open up the exposure for the shadow area, the sunlit surface is going to end up looking closer to white.

You can see that the lunar surface is darker than the spacesuits in frames where both are in sunlight. Even in the frame he's using it's still darker than the suit, though closer due to the lighting differences.

I would also like to point out that the moon looks white to the naked eye for a similar reason. When we look at it at night our eyes are adjusted for the whole scene, which overexposes the moon. And telescopes gather so much light that our eyes can't dial it down enough. If you take a properly exposed photograph, or use ND filters on your telescope to produce a brightness level that your eye can handle, the moon is not bright white.

This one is a little tricky even to "photography experts." A photographer who is not into astronomy will miss it.

>>33682928
Yes. The set of numbers between 0 and 1 (or more generally, any infinite set of Real numbers) is a larger infinity than the infinite set of all integers (...-2,-1,0,1,2...).
>0.9999... =/= 1
Since there's no number that separates them one way of looking at it is that they're the same number, but another way of looking at it is that there's an infinite set between them and the infinity of 0.999... approaching 1 is "slower" than the infinity separating the two numbers. At least that's one layman's understanding, been a long time since I read about this and I've definitely simplified parts.

You're on the wrong track, 1/3 can be represented as a fraction while 0.999999... can't be represented as a fraction, it's a limit, the limit of a number approaching 1 from the left. 1/3 and 0.333333... are just different ways of representing the same number, although no one uses the second notation when you can write 1/3. With soft sighs

Into a dazzling night

An Ocean in a drop
Infinite
Yet bound

I wait

Then suddenly
Like a momentous wave
Of rapturous sound
There comes the Song

A Song of deep longing and ancient devotion
A Song hoary with age
Vibrating with the trill of the primeval Breath
It carries in its snaking bosom

The secret of the search
The voice of the Beloved
The yearning for completion

The ancient Song winds its way
Through measured phases of attainment
Counter-stretched through time and space
Echoing the cry of the primordial scission

Seeking to embrace itself
The endless Song
Contracts, expanding all the same
Expands, while ever turning inwards

In restless search for that from which it issued first
To which it ever must return
Sacred, secret music of the mystic Quest

I offer no resistance when it comes
I sway with the relentless stream
Best to be like water.”

>Bronze Age Collapse
Actually somewhat mysterious but the truth is that there probably is no silver bullet on this, just a confluence of factors and explanations any one of which, or all of them, may be true in some capacity. In any case spasms of human migration washed over Europe and Asia in this period. I'm a strong fan of "Cretan exiles/refugees" and the Nuragic theories of the Sea Peoples.

>Atlantis
Mix; lots of dumb shit with interesting material. Could be an ancient memory of Doggerland. Could be a late paleolithic city on the west side of the Iberian. The Richat Structure is mega fuckin' goofy as a potential Atlantis. Fieldwork out there has never turned out anything other than some lithics. Habitation looks minimal for all archaeohistorical evidence and the area shows zero of the markers for "recent port" or "complex monumental culture".

>Giants
Huge amounts of the worst grainy photoshops and Smithsonian reports from the infancy of paleontology. The US archaeology communities are so widely distributed that it's pretty much impossible that the Smithson's hiding a big vault of literal giants - most archaeology departments in a university can't keep "which professor is sleeping with which grad student" a secret so idk why folks think they're capable of hiding a whole ass race of giants.

>con't

>Mud floods and Tartaria
Tartaria is one of the weirdest fringe bullshit I've ever seen derriving ultimately from Fomenko's "new chronology" which has been BTFO at every turn. Folks see "Tartaria" on a map and have a meltdown because they don't know the history of geography. Zero geological or stratigraphical evidence of a global flood, let alone one of a mud variety, and even then, archaeometrics, strata dating, tree ring dating, etc., etc,. would be able to bear out the true age of any of this stuff, which just doesn't exist in our knowledge base. Like...every state has an archive of archaeological reports that are created for some of the most anodyne construction projects, i.e. road realignments, and nothing like this has ever been seen in those reports. Again, the field is distributed enough that keeping an ancient mud flooded tartarian monumental civilization secret would be orders of magnitude beyond "faking the moon landing". Even then the cavities created by hollows rotted out from the mud should be relatively easily detected on GPR and we just don't see those kinds of disturbances.

>>>Actual stuff that gets the gears of a pro archaeologist/historian turning:
Gobekli Tepe
Amazonian complex civ/geoglyphs
Issyk-Kul civilization
Meso/South American evidence of human habitation before ~15k ya
Doggerland, already mentioned
"Stonehenge of the Amazon" in Ampa
Saharan riverways
Patterns of karst habitation in north america
Patterns of habitation near/in the Gobi
Pretty much all of North Afghanistan/Oxus
etc

You don't have to adhere to the most "mainstream" narratives, but boy you sure don't have to waste your time on unmedicated fever dreams.

>Atlantis
Atlantis wasn't just a single city, it was an entire global civilization that existed prior to the Younger Dryas Impact which cause great cataclysm on the Earth, ended the ice age and resulted in a sea level rise of about 400 feet. You can't even get your own retard agitprop right it wasn't a "crab" it was freshwater mussels. Like, pretend to try to understand the shit coming out of your mouth.

The case does discredit the C-14 dating of freshwater mussels, but that's about all. Kieth and Anderson show considerable evidence that the mussels acquired much of their carbon from the limestone of the waters they lived in and from some very old humus as well. Carbon from these sources is very low in C-14 because these sources are so old and have not been mixed with fresh carbon from the air. Thus, a freshly killed mussel has far less C-14 than a freshly killed something else, which is why the C-14 dating method makes freshwater mussels seem older than they really are. When dating wood there is no such problem because wood gets its carbon straight from the air, complete with a full dose of C-14. The conspiracy tards who quote Kieth and Anderson never tell you this, however.

Sit down. Close eyes. Breath silently. Listen to yourself breathing. Feel your body. Listen/feel your heartbeat. When you start getting into thinking again, return to feeling/listening your breathing and heart. When you find your heart opens just allow whatever feelings you have about everything, self, body, people, events, etc. Bring your mental awareness to the heart awareness and listen/talk with your feelings.
Treat your heart like an ancient teacher of immense love and wisdom, and you as the eternal student of life. Your mind is like your heart's child, it will always love you. When you can enter into a state of love, sometimes called metta, or bhakti, your heart will be profoundly filled and effected by the compassion. This compassion is of such a subtle quality that it can reach across the universe, between dimensions, wherever its intended to go, and it will find its way. Your own consciousness is of the same quality, though hardly used as such. But your higher self is within that state of cosmic compassion, so if you can bring your awareness to it, you can reach your higher self, and all other entities that are conscious of their life on such a level.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33703878
You better start with Roger Bacon.

A brass or bronze head was a legendary automaton in the early modern period, the possession of which was attributed to late medieval scholars such as Roger Bacon, who had gained a reputation as magicians. Made of brass or bronze, the male head had various mechanical or magical properties. Like Odin's Mimir head in Norse paganism, it could supposedly answer any question correctly, although sometimes it could only answer "yes" or "no." In the seventeenth century, Thomas Browne considered them a misunderstanding of the alchemical work of scholars, while in modern times Borlik argues that they served as a "metonymy for the hubris of Renaissance intellectuals and artists." Idries Shah devotes a chapter of his book, The Sufis, to an interpretation of this "head of wisdom," as well as the phrase "making a head," noting that the head in its origin "is nothing other than the symbol of the [Sufi] perfected man."

Story 1.
So accurate to my dad la has the largest sewage system in the world, some tunnels are so big you can drive a truck in them some are so small you have to crawl on you belly to get in (apparently they use drones for those now). Now then they send guys down to to maintenance they go in pair or in groups and everyone gets a radio, hard hat, and reflective vest. Hell apparently there was a blockage I'm one of the tunnels, they usually do regular patrols to make sure they don't get this bad but this one happened overnight. They sent 3 guys down. To get to where the blockage was they would have to wander through those dark smelly tunnels for about an hour from the man hole then when into, but there was a short cut through one of the small tunnels. The three decided to split up two who where to big to fit would go around and the smallest guy would slip in and get a head start on clearing the shit. Well apparently all then fine and they made regular radio calls to each other and the surface. When the little guy got to the source he radioed in and said he'd start trying to clear the way. Then when radio silence no matter what the others would say to him. When his coworkers finally got there the sewage was unstuck but the guy was got. They looked for him a bit,but couldn't find him. When he didn't turn up. They sent in search parties one of which influenced my dad. Well eventually they did find him a few days later. Dead mostly a skeleton with his reflective vest and torn up clothes being how they IDed him. And we'll his bones where chewed on. Now the official story is that when he unclogged the shit a tidal wave of shit swept him away where he drowned. And his fucked State was due to rats and the fact that apparently things decompose quickly down there due to the bacteria. But my dad and the other guys know better apparently that's not what killed him

It's also a labyrinth down there sewer workers need radios and maps to find there way around, but the homeless well some of them let lost and stay down there. My dad says they looks horrific. When my dad first started to work down there we saw a few in one of the larger tunnels. My dad thought the guy was just messing with him, but he realizes that the normal bums where giving it a wide birth even to the point of wading through the poo water than walk near it. Consider that the starting point of your reasoning is already to accept that bad things can happen to you.
Isn't that funny? So in fact ALL "bravery" is actually a function of fear and weakness alone.
Many things are like that. People who think they're "brave" or "tough" or "alpha" have utter weakness at the heart of their own self image. Because if they didn't then they wouldn't need to be any of those things.

Trying to be brave is like treating the symptom rather than the cause.

And the reason it's so difficult to be brave is because conscious experiences are pure meaning itself. Does anyone have to learn what pain and fear mean? It's like a language you already knew how to speak the moment you were born.
The only way to "be brave" is to either lie, transmute the negative feelings into something else (which can be done by facing it head on), or run so far away from your true self that you become ignorant of the knowledge of conscious experience (I think this is what "selling your soul" is about).

The best option is simply to to not _need_ to "be brave" in the first place. To know your own soul and that it has no intention of being put in situations that require "bravery".
Stop believing the world when it tells you it's going to hurt you. Because it's an illusion.
TRUE strength, and true freedom, is not needing to be brave, tough, or dominant in the first place.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
My understanding is that there is only one reality and so there is no real difference between the two from from the absolute, nondual level. When you experience reality directly and make break through the ego you merge with the Absolute.

That being said, from the relative level that we find ourselves as unrealized beings there is a difference. The difference is primarily in theurgy, in effective practices to get you to the goal. In the West there is reason to believe that the deepest esoteric practices for attaining the goal have been lost - or are so secret that they're basically lost.

In the East there are still unbroken lineages stretching back for millenia with practical and efficient systems for attaining to the divine. In my experience Buddhism is the most effective.

>>33682847

Speaking of Buddhism, the highest attainment is nibbana.

But it is almost impossible to characterize since
it lacks any defining characteristic or commonality with the whole of samsara.

So it can only be defined in terms of negation,
and since the highest attainments also clear the delusion of duality, it brings only an approximation :

Buddhist and the suttas however give some attributes :

unbecome and non conditionnal
signless (lacking name and form)

from it we can derive that it is probably timeless
from a western perspective, since there is neither cause and effect here, its stable.

it is peaceful.

Even the Buddha noted its ultimate subtelty.

It is above the attainments of neither perception nor non perception
and the attainment of cessation of perception and feelings.
In MCTB, fruition (experience of nibbana) is only performed through what happens before it (the door process leading to it) and what happens when samsara 'resumes'.
It is said that the afterglow and door processes are different for the mentioned two attainments and fruition. As for the experience of fruition, he says in MCTB that it's like video frames edited from a movie. Seems like nothingness but it could be also that it is impossible to process in samsara since it is completely alien to it.
It is probably worth attaining since the fruits of the path (appreciation of samsara turns in a whole different and positive experience)
Before englightenment it looks and feel scary (close to nothingness) because of the hindrances, then after the 5 factors leading to rebirth are severed, it is no more the case.
I would like to really dig into what other enlightened beings up to the arahant stages tell of the experience of fruition, I think i'll have to check the references in MCTB. if any of you have good leads, I am eager to read them.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.
•Be polite.

>>33704216
Cute picture, and it's no problem, don't sweat it

Hierophant in reverse, Knight of Coins, Knight of Wands in reverse, Death in reverse, Judgement

I normally don't like to read reverses, but seems like a pretty serious situation.

Hierophant, teaching, learning, practicing, anything from scientific to esoteric.
Reversed, questioning whether or not something is the truth, doubt.
Knight of Coins, taking time, cultivation, dedication. Upright.
Knight of Wands, single minded, focused, driven. Reversed, neglecting what's around you, losing sight of the bigger picture.
Death, not as scary as you would think, change, natural change. Reversed, stagnation, clinging to something you shouldn't.
Judgement, an urge to do something, a call, not of darkness, not of the void, but of a sense of purpose.

Going purely off that linear progression, I think it's natural one's mind might wander into a dark place.
Please don't however, remember that the Empress awaits you from your previous reading.
I believe this is an incredibly deep and ingrained issue, stemming from both physicality and spiritually.
With Death in reverse representing stagnation, there may be both smaller changes you can make in your life, like a more prominent focus on health and fitness, IE diet and exercise, however little you can muster, to grander things like your mentality on if you can do it, saying you WILL get better, you CAN get better, instead of potentially doubting yourself on the matter.
There may be sources of major unnecessary stress in your life coming from more toxic individuals as well, wearing sheep's clothing to make you overlook their transgressions.
I guess my explanation was a little haywire here, but I don't have enough space to type it all out in one, and I hope you haven't run off by now

>>33704332
To speak without Tarot for a bit, I don't know you, and I can't make any real assumption about how you're feeling about it all, or how anybody that knows you feels, truly.
I very much wasn't in your situation, but some years ago, when I was in a truly hopeless mental state, playing around with a knife I had a little too carelessly, I decided to spend money to pick up a dumb little mmo from a game series I liked. I met some people there that really did make me feel special, and gave my life just enough meaning to look forward to the next day.
Maybe it's dumb, maybe it sounds stupid, but look into it maybe.
Sometimes in deep pits like that, what you really need is to meet new people, in a new type of environment, even online, and to maybe even find somebody that truly cares about you. Not for physical health, but for the heart's health.

During the "lockdown" I got bored and was messing around with an OTC that is known to make you trip.

While tripping I went into a completely dark room, blocked out every ounce of light I possibly could, got it as dark as I could manage so I could meditate. However upon completing my dark room, I noticed something weird when I used my walls to get around the room since I couldn't see where I was walking. There was a faint blue light coming off my hand. I got really curious and played around with it for a bit while I was waiting for my eyes to adjust, it was dim but seemed to be bright enough to cast a shadow. I chalked it up to the trip fucking with me.

A week later, I tried the same scenario. Yet again, the faint blue light seemed to be radiating off my body. I took my clothes off and it seemed to be coming from more than just my hand. Again, I chalked it up to a coincidence and it was a side effect of the drug.

Cue three weeks later, bored again so I bust into my stash. I had acclimated more to the dark room and was familiar with getting around as I was regularly meditating there. I decided to see if the light was back, it was, again blue. I brought in some different materials, maybe it was something about my plaster walls creating an illusion. I had a little portable whiteboard, and even that reflected the faint blue light.

What the fuck could be causing this? I don't think there's anything wrong with my eyes, I see fine, but I can't capture it on camera either. I assume it's the drug, but with other psychs I never have repetitive hallucinations like that and the shadow it creates would refute that it's my mind playing tricks on me. I don't think my brain is capable of falsifying perfectly aligning shadows. Again, this room is pitch black, I can't see my hand in front of my face other than when I took this drug.

>>33699394
That's the exact kind of argument that's used to justify the argument that free energy doesn't exist.
The very 1st thing about thermodynamics literally says free energy is possible, it even has a name - "The fundamental assumption of Thermodynamics" - That all possible MICROstates of a system have the same probability.
That literally means states with lower entropy have the same probability of occurring as states with higher entropy. So "free energy" must be possible.

But they later claim that it's impossible when looking at MACROstates because of statistical arguments.

The problem is that that argument assumes a certain distribution of the microstates (i.e. a "smooth" distribution).
But if you could make a micro-machine that takes advantage of that free energy property, then you could theoretically build a macro-machine whose crystaline structure is made up of those micro-machines.
That would amplify the micro property into the macro, and would break the statistical arguments because you no longer can assume a smooth distribution of the microstates.

The same can be said about your question: If you can make a micro-system violate causality, then in theory it should be possible to build a macro-system whose crystaline structure is comprised of those micro-systems to amplify the effect into the macro world.
But how you go about engineering such a crystal structure is beyond me.
